intro: Homalolepis suffruticosa, commonly known as the rock fig, is a woody shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, branching structure and small, clustered leaves. Its fruit, which is edible, is enclosed in a fleshy, greenish husk that turns brown as it matures. Homalolepis suffruticosa is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
